title: Request for NYPD Documents and Memos Regarding Press Dealings and Press Credentials

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to any documents or memos related to the New York City Police Department's (NYPD) dealings with the press or obtaining press credentials, for the period of January 1, 2022 to the present.

I am specifically interested in any documents or memos that provide guidance or procedures to NYPD officers on how to handle interactions with members of the press, how to verify the authenticity of press credentials, or how to distinguish between legitimate press activity and unlawful activity.

I would like to remind you of the New York State case law that prohibits the deletion, redaction, or withholding of responsive information unless the information is specifically exempted from disclosure under FOIL. In Buffalo News, Inc. v. Buffalo Enterprise Development Corp., 84 N.Y.2d 488, 493 (1994), the court held that "[e]xemptions from disclosure must be narrowly construed, with the burden resting on the agency to demonstrate that the requested material falls squarely within a FOIL exemption." Therefore, I respectfully request that you provide me with a written explanation for any exemption claimed for the requested documents.

Please note that any deletion, redaction, or withholding of information that is not specifically exempted under FOIL will be considered a violation of the law, and I will file a complaint and take legal action to compel the disclosure of the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

title: Communications and Documents Related to Trump Indictment and NYPD Monitoring of Protests

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to the following records for the time period of January 1, 2023 to the present:

All communications (including emails, letters, memos, and text messages) between the New York City Police Department (NYPD) and the Manhattan District Attorney's Office (DANY) related to the preparation and readiness of an indictment against Donald Trump, his associates, or his businesses.

All documents (including intelligence reports, after action reports, and surveillance logs) related to NYPD's monitoring of protests or demonstrations that take place in New York City.

I would like to remind you of the New York State case law that prohibits the deletion, redaction, or withholding of responsive information unless the information is specifically exempted from disclosure under FOIL. In Westchester Rockland Newspapers, Inc. v. Kimball, 50 N.Y.2d 575, 581 (1980), the court held that "[t]he burden rests upon the agency to demonstrate that the material falls squarely within a FOIL exemption by articulating a particularized and specific justification for denying access." Therefore, I respectfully request that you provide me with a written explanation for any exemption claimed for the requested documents.

Please note that any deletion, redaction, or withholding of information that is not specifically exempted under FOIL will be considered a violation of the law, and I will file a complaint and take legal action to compel the disclosure of the information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen
